  • Constructor Details

    • GameScreen

      public GameScreen(@NotNull ComponentGenerator componentGenerator, MapModel mapModel, PlayerColor color, GameClient gameClient)
      Constructs a GameScreen with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      componentGenerator - the component generator used to create UI components
      mapModel - the model representing the game map
      color - the player's color
      gameClient - the game client for handling game logic

  • Method Details

    • changeLabelText

      public void changeLabelText(int labelID, String text)
      Changes the text of a label on the game screen.
      Parameters:
      labelID - The ID of the label to be modified.
      text - The new text to set for the label.

    • updateFieldType

      public void updateFieldType(@NotNull List<Integer> fields, ComponentGenerator.FieldType fieldType)
      Updates the graphical representation of multiple fields on the game board.
      Parameters:
      fields - A list of field indices to be updated.
      fieldType - The new type to set for the specified fields.

    • updateFieldType

      public void updateFieldType(int field, ComponentGenerator.FieldType fieldType)
      Updates the graphical representation of a specific field on the game board.
      Parameters:
      field - The index of the field to be updated.
      fieldType - The new type to set for the specified field.

    • hide

      public void hide()
      Hides the game screen.

    • updateStacks

      public void updateStacks(PlayerColor color, int myUnitsLeftToPlace, int myUnitsRemoved, int opponentUnitsLeftToPlace, int opponentUnitsRemoved)
      Updates the stacks of pieces for both players based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player making the update (LIGHT or DARK).
      myUnitsLeftToPlace - The number of units left to place for the player.
      myUnitsRemoved - The number of units removed from the player.
      opponentUnitsLeftToPlace - The number of units left to place for the opponent.
      opponentUnitsRemoved - The number of units removed from the opponent.

    • show

      public void show()
      Displays the game screen.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of the game screen and releases any associated resources.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the game and disposes of the game screen.
